<!-- <UL>
<H2>Java Computing Portal or Grande Computing Framework</H2>
<BR></UL></P>
<P><UL>
<LI><H2>So computer users are interested in in being able to run their jobs in a seamless way that does not keep changing as backend computer resources are upgraded
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>Also new computing models such as webs of workstations, arrays of Java chips …
<LI>Java makes code run anywhere but more to a job than code
</UL></UL><UL>
<LI><H2>Viewing computing as a distributed (object) service, need to define a "Java Computing Portal Framework"
</H2>
</UL><UL>
<LI><H2>This enables development of Web Interfaces (“Portals”) to run a given job on any computer with any data source compliant with this framework just as JDBC gives a universal interface to any relational database
</H2>
<UL>
<LI>Metacomputing in addition allows linkage of multiple computers to run together on a single job
</UL></UL><UL>
<LI><H2>The Computing Portal Framework will allow vendors to compete on either User Front End (GUI) or back end services with the JavaCS framework providing universal linkage </H2>
</UL></P>
<P>  -->
